reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this Ryokan based on the great reviews and reasonable price. We were not disappointed. I can not compare to other Ryokans, because I haven't stayed in any, but wanted a more traditional experience while in Kyoto.
reviews.title: Glad we stayed here!
Kyoto Tour.
reviews.text: Our room was clean and quiet, and sleeping on Tatami mats on the floor was comfortable. The hardest part was getting 'out of bed', when sleeping on the floor. The room did not have any chairs, but mats and a 'tea' table. Robes and slippers are also provided. The traditional breakfast, for about $10, is worth a try. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Warmly Welcoming
reviews.text: The location is conveniently located near Kyoto station, where the public buses are available. The station also is loaded with restaurants and the post office next door has ATMs. Also in the station, there's a tourist office that can help with information, maps and you can purchase bus passes for the day there. It's a few blocks walk to Ryokan Shimizu. On the way there are conveniences stores, some restaurants and cafes, and a grocery store.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really recomend this Japanese Ryokan in our visit of the Kyoto city. It is very good located. In addition the staff is very friendly and finally is very clean and tidy. I had the best acomodation in my vacation in this amazing country. They have felt me like at home.
reviews.title: Traveler oriented ryokan
